text: Do we have functionality to export all functions from a module yet? Something like `export *` ? Alternatively, is there a way I can get the function symbol names from a module, so i can write a little for loop that will formulate a string "export func1, func2, func3" so I don't have to do it manually?

elements.text: Do we have functionality to export all functions from a module yet? Something like
export *

? Alternatively, is there a way I can get the function symbol names from a module, so i can write a little for loop that will formulate a string "export func1, func2, func3" so I don't have to do it manually?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Ahh, needed this
```julia> names(Main.mymodule, all=true)```
I can probably use this to create a one-time string

text: Don't use strings for this! unnecessary extra parsing

elements.text: Don't use strings for this! unnecessary extra parsing

text:
```julia> Meta.@dump export a,b,c
Expr                          
  head: Symbol export         
  args: Array{Any}((3,))      
    1: Symbol a               
    2: Symbol b               
    3: Symbol c               
                              
julia> names(Main, all=true)  
6-element Vector{Symbol}:     
 Symbol("##meta#51")          
 :Base                        
 :Core                        
 :InteractiveUtils            
 :Main                        
 :ans                         ```

elements.text:
julia> Meta.@dump export a,b,c
Expr                          
  head: Symbol export         
  args: Array{Any}((3,))      
    1: Symbol a               
    2: Symbol b               
    3: Symbol c               
                              
julia> names(Main, all=true)  
6-element Vector{Symbol}:     
 Symbol("##meta#51")          
 :Base                        
 :Core                        
 :InteractiveUtils            
 :Main                        
 :ans

text:
You _will_ want to be careful with `names` though, as it also includes other functions that you really don't want to export:

```julia> module A                                                               
        f() = "hello"                                                         
        eval(Expr(:export, names(A, all=true)...))                            
       end                                                                    
Main.A                                                                        
                                                                              
julia> using .A                                                               
WARNING: using A.include in module Main conflicts with an existing identifier.
WARNING: using A.eval in module Main conflicts with an existing identifier.   
                                                                              
julia> f()                                                                    
"hello"                                                                       ```

elements.text: You
will
want to be careful with
names
though, as it also includes other functions that you really don't want to export:

julia> module A                                                               
        f() = "hello"                                                         
        eval(Expr(:export, names(A, all=true)...))                            
       end                                                                    
Main.A                                                                        
                                                                              
julia> using .A                                                               
WARNING: using A.include in module Main conflicts with an existing identifier.
WARNING: using A.eval in module Main conflicts with an existing identifier.   
                                                                              
julia> f()                                                                    
"hello"

text: it's also not a good idea to use this in general - you'll export all anonymous functions as well as whatever else floats around in global scope

elements.text: it's also not a good idea to use this in general - you'll export all anonymous functions as well as whatever else floats around in global scope

text: so while you _can_ do this, you really shouldn't, as it _will_ pollute the namespace of whoever is `using A`, thereby defeating the whole purpose of using modules in the first place
